name: places/ChIJl4G1KxVZwokRCBPRVoWCNxU
formattedAddress: 121 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 121 E 27th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

editorialSummary.text: Stylish lounge outfitted with flat-screen TVs for watching sports while sipping craft cocktails.

originalText.text: Such a cool speakeasy! Took us a second to find the entrance as you can't see the bar from the outside. A hostess will greet you and check your coat before leading you into the bar. The atmosphere is great. It's a perfect location for drinks with friends, dates, etc. Very laid back vibe. While the drinks were good, they were a little on the pricey side and service was very slow. Didn't try any food so can't weigh in there. If you're looking for a cool place to talk, relax, and have a few drinks I'd recommend.

text.text: Such a cool speakeasy! Took us a second to find the entrance as you can't see the bar from the outside. A hostess will greet you and check your coat before leading you into the bar. The atmosphere is great. It's a perfect location for drinks with friends, dates, etc. Very laid back vibe. While the drinks were good, they were a little on the pricey side and service was very slow. Didn't try any food so can't weigh in there. If you're looking for a cool place to talk, relax, and have a few drinks I'd recommend.

originalText.text: I booked a cocktail class for a group of six and was incredibly impressed with the manager Eric who was attentive, kind and quick to respond during the booking process. The atmosphere and cocktails were AMAZING and they give each person their own cocktail tools. I ordered the food in advance and they had everything timed perfectly for us. We were not able to take our tools with us so Eric shipped them to all six of us individually. Whether for the class or just a beautiful bar and delicious cocktail, I highly recommend this speakeasy. üëçüòä

originalText.text:
We found this speakeasy by chance on our way to dinner, which reminded me of a similar concept in Montreal.

Once past the secret door, you will see a cozy ‚Äúliving room‚Äù with a few TV screens and a big screen behind the bar. I had the peat & tiki, and my partner got the mcAvoy as recommended by the waitress. I was surprised by how complex peat & tiki was - I tasted so many different flavors within one drink.

The service was prompt and friendly. The decors were posh and sleek. It is hard to imagine how rowdy it could get during a major sport‚Äôs event.

The service was prompt and friendly. The decors were posh and sleek. It is hard to imagine how rowdy it could get during a major sport‚Äôs event.

originalText.text: Discovered this spot through a friend.  It's a cool experience to walk through the custom tailored suit shop that acts as the front entrance and enter into the speakeasy.  Has a cool vibe with dark interior design and a good amount of seating.  Great service and good drinks.  Will definitely be back

originalText.text:
This is the flagship store that hosts the NYC Macy‚Äôs Thanksgiving day parade and is heavily advertised among NYC‚Äôs most iconic buildings and companies. It spans, essentially, 1 full NYC block and goes up to 8 floors! It is heavily trafficked amongst locals and tourists. It gets a little hectic and because of that, the items can get a bit disheveled, mishandled and misplaced, which doesn‚Äôt really scream luxury. For that reason, I‚Äôve never bought anything from here outside of souvenirs. The staff are generally nice.

During the holidays, they have some pretty cute window displays that are interactive (at least this year), although nowhere near as elegant and luxurious as the window displays on Saks 5th Avenue.
